remarks: Definition of the category Set, relativized to a subset ` u ` .  Example 3.3(1) of [Adamek] p. 22.  This is the category of all sets in ` u ` and functions between these sets.  Generally, we will take ` u ` to be a weak universe or Grothendieck universe, because these sets have closure properties as good as the real thing.  (Contributed by FL, 8-Nov-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
